instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.A1502: What is A1502? A1502 is a model number for a 13 inch size MacBook Pro Retina from years Mid 2014, Late 2013, Early 2015 with EMC 2875, that may contain one of these boards depending on the year & configuration: 820-3476, 820-3536, 820-4924..
definitions.820-4924: What is 820-4924? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.820-3476: What is 820-3476? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.820-3536: What is 820-3536? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1502</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> board compatibility
threads.message:
I have compared these 3 boards: 

<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3536</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>
<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3476</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>
<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>

All these board al interchangable?

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1502</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> board compatibility
<MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1502</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> board compatibility
threads.message: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3536</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> and <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3476</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> are interchangeable (as far as I know--we use the same test cases for them without issues--someone will correct me if I'm wrong, but we've noticed there are no issues). The <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> uses a different trackpad connector, so it's not interchangeable.

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1502</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> board compatibility
threads.message: 4924 also will not work with older screen

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1502</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> board compatibility
threads.message:
100% <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3536</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> and <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3476</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> are interchangeable??
Can somebody confirm that??

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1502</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> board compatibility
